channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-13096] Cost to choose side table in MapJoin conversion based on cumulative cardinality
item.description:
HIVE-11954 changed the logic to choose the side table in the MapJoin conversion algorithm. Initial heuristic for the cost was based on number of heavyweight operators.

This extends that work so the heuristic is based on accumulate cardinality. In the future, we should choose the side based on total latency for the input.
item.summary: Cost to choose side table in MapJoin conversion based on cumulative cardinality

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12788905 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
ashutoshc, could you take a look? Thanks

Instead of recursively adding cardinality of tree for each operator, I think following heuristic might be better:

getCummCardinality (Operator op) {
  if (op.type = join) {
   cummCardinality += maxCardinality from all branches; 
}  else {
return cummCardinality;
}
}

That is to say, cardinality from any operator other than join does not contribute in cumulative cardinality. And for join, max cardinality from its input contribute in cummulative cardinality of tree. This is akin to what we have on logical side, where getCumulativeCost() is overriden only for join and is overriden in manner suggested here.

ashutoshc, thanks for checking.

In fact, I had missed that the getCumulativeCost method was overriden for Join operators (as it is part of HiveRelMdDistinctRowCount ), thanks for catching that. However, the default getCumulativeCost is still applied over the rest of the operators (it is in RelMdPercentageOriginalRows).

Hence, to mimic CBO cumulative cardinality estimation, we should combine both. I have uploaded a new patch with the updated method.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12789388/HIVE-13096.02.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12789935 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
This heuristic change should have supposedly impacted only selection of table chosen for streaming, and not change shape of tez dag. Is that expected ?

ashutoshc, I finally could take a look back at this one.

The heuristic change impacts the selection of table chosen for streaming, and it might change the shape of the DAG too e.g. in the presence of GB + Join.

For instance, consider bucket_map_join_tez1.q.

  • Previously, the shape was: 
    Reducer 2 <- Map 1 (SIMPLE_EDGE), Map 3 (CUSTOM_SIMPLE_EDGE)

    Reducer2 contains a GB on the input from Map1 (TS on table1), followed by a Join.
    In this case, Map3 (TS on table2) is broadcasted for the Join execution that is done in Reduce2.

  • With the patch, the shape is: 
            Map 3 <- Reducer 2 (CUSTOM_EDGE)
        Reducer 2 <- Map 1 (SIMPLE_EDGE)

    Reducer2 contains a GB on the input from Map1 (TS on table1).
    In this case, the output of GB is broadcasted for the Join execution that is done in Map3.
Thanks ashutoshc, I will run a new QA before committing, as latest was run almost a week ago.
